newsitem.title: OMAN: Oman bank stocks lead market higher.
newsitem.headline: Oman bank stocks lead market higher.

text.p: Oman stocks rose six percent in the week to Wednesday with bank and investment stocks leading the market higher, the exchange said.
The index rose to 248.37 points from last week's 234.39 points, bringing gains so far this year to 24.58 percent.
Profit taking on Wednesday capped the week's rise with the index losing 2.38 points on the day.
The value of the week's total trade reached 34.52 million rials from 27.11 million rials the previous week, the Muscat Securities Market (MSM) said.
Some 11.55 million shares changed hands in 3,242 deals compared with 9.29 million shares the previous week.
Of the 62 companies traded, 36 rose, 10 were steady and 16 fell.
Among major gainers were Oman Flour Mills which closed at 4,050 rials from 3,500 rials and National Bank of Oman which closed at 5,500 rials from 4,900 the previous close.
The banking and investment sectors accounted for 82 percent of the week's total trade value.
